result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin L Pieper

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 2:23 pm
INCLUDES 21CF1395 & 22CF18.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person.
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Jessica Phelps in person.
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
21CF1395:
Ct. 1 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense))>>DRI.
Ct. 2 >> Amend Count 2 to Add the Enhancer of "Domestic Abuse" pursuant to 968.075.

22CF18:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse Repeater-Domestic Abuse Repeater-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
21CF1395:
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property-Domestic Abuse)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding. Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
21CF1395:
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with the Victim J.M.H. unless approved by agent, Participate with the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 15 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, I/S 15 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Court finds 3 Days Credit.

DATES:
Probation Review Hearing 07/15/2022 @ 1:15 pm

Adjourned: 2:35 pm
Probation review hearing on July 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on April 4, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
ATTIC:  Intake Report - Marathon County Pretrial Services Program

Clerk: Becca.  
Called: 8:37 am. 
INCLUDES: 21CF1395 & 22CF18.

State appears by ADA Davis Runde via Zoom video.
Defendant Justin Pieper appears in person. Attorney Jessica Phelps appears via Zoom video.

Date and time set for judicial pretrial conference; VRCW.  
ADA Runde makes statement; offer was provided but new charges are now filed. Atty Phelps requests another JPTC be set.

COURT sets PTC w/ JA: 02/11/2022 @ 10:00 am.

Adj: 8:39 am.

No contact with victim(s): J.M.H. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Case called:  2:14 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears in custody from MCJ via video with Atty Trevor Peterson.    

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived.

COURT ORDERS: $1500.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): J.M.H. (non-waivable).  
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

JPTC:  1/06/22 at 8:30 a.m. 

Adj:  2:16 p.m. 

Branch 1 case.
